column1: excellent carry to the keeper right away. Shoulder-high carry to de Kock. Steep bounce. Short of a length, angling away, seaming away in the channel. Left alone
short and slanting away outside off, left alone again
back of a length and on leg stump, 137ks, Raval camps back and defensively drops the ball into the cover region
135.3ks, back of a length and veering away just outside off, Raval is happy to shoulder arms again
tight line on middle, Raval is tight too, plays with soft hands in the direction of point
136ks, back of a length and into the hips, firmly flicked away....Cook, under the helmet, at short leg, moves to his right and snaps up the ball. Cat-like reflexes from Cook
back of a length, shapes in slightly, Latham plays around his front pad, and wears it on the thigh pad
Philander finds some inswing but strays down the leg side. Latham attempts a leg glance and does not connect with it
full and on off, inches forward and defends
pitched up and outside off, watchfully left alone
a bit too full and outside off, Latham eases forward, meets the pitch, and serenely drives it past the outstretched left foot of Philander, also beats mid-on to his right. Finesse
good length on off, forward-defensive from Latham
back of a length and angling away outside off, Raval ushers it through to the keeper
similar length on off and middle, the batsman ventures back and across in defence
here comes the full tempter - angling away wide outside off - Raval isn't tempted
that's a ripper! Back of a length and seaming away outside off, Raval is now tempted into fishing in the channel. Morne beats Raval on the outside edge
back of a length on middle and leg, shuffles across and defends to short leg
short of a length on middle, Raval stoutly defends with a straight bat. Back-to-back maidens for Morne, though
good length and angling away wide outside off, left alone
much fuller but the line isn't close enough to off to make him play
just short of a good length on middle, fended to cover on the back foot
nice and full, attacking the stumps, Raval's forward-defensive intervenes
good length and slanting away on and around off, presses forward and dabs to point with soft hands
back of a length on middle, seams away, blocked to the off side on the front foot, head over the ball, right out of the coaching manual

first runs off Morkel after 15 balls. Full and Morkel runs this across the left-hander, bounces at Latham. He jabs at the ball with hard hands and an outside edge streaks away between third slip and gully

good length, seams back in to ping the front pad just above the knee-roll as the batsman fails to cover the line. Latham weathers the lbw appeal. SA don't chance a review though Morkel was very eager for it. Faf shot Morne down. It might have returned umpire's call on off stump. Oh dear, the tracker returns three reds. Hitting the top of off stump
nice and full outside off, leans forward and caresses it through the covers
good length on off, defended on the front foot
tantalisingly close to the off stump, tight, tight leave from Raval
full and swinging into the pads, picked off to long leg for one. Raval opens his account after 19 balls
full and Philander runs this one across the left-hander, left alone
full again, this is at off, defended back to Philander on the front foot
pretty full and swinging in, Latham falls over the flick, and is rapped on the pads, but this ball was doing too much. Heading down leg
Philander puts it full and outside off, Raval covers his off stump and lets it pass
back of a length, Morne hits the deck and gets it to swerve back into Latham. He plays around his front pad, and is beaten

Morne produces the breakthrough! Lovely delivery. Elgar pouches a smart catch at third slip. Latham's woes continue. You don't need DRS for this. Full and Morne runs this across the left-hander from over the wicket. Seams away and bounces at the batsman. Latham is stapled to the crease as he prods with an angled bat and edges it behind. He had to play at it; the line was around off. Morne finds reward for an excellent opening spell
good length on off, solidly defended
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Williamson plays for the angle, and watches the ball skip past the outside edge
Williamson eyes up the leg side, this one is angled into him, a leading edge rolls to point
too full and straight, tucked away to the right of short leg for a couple
full and swerving away outside off, no shot offered
back of a length and slanting away outside off, punched to point on the back foot, Bavuma swoops down on the ball
pitched further up and angling away outside off, left alone
good length and sharply seaming away, Raval judges it well. Covers his off stump and lets it pass
overpitched on middle and leg, Raval spurns a scoring opportunity. Clips it straight to midwicket
length and too wide outside off, ignored
just short of a good length and angled in, defended
length and just a shade outside off, Williamson watches it through to the keeper
back of a length on off, Williamson hops and fends to cover point with gentle hands
this is short again and much wide outside off, Williamson lets another one pass
much fuller and holds its line outside off, left alone

big appeal for leg-before, and Williamson has been given out by umpire Dharmasena. He calls for DRS, pointing to his back thigh. RTS does not detect a spike. No bat involved. Nice and full, swings back in prodigiously after pitching outside off, beats the inside edge and crashes into the back pad in front of middle. Williamson brought his bat in line, but the ball did too much. TV umpire Oxenford says: 'Ball-tracking is not available'. What? Bizarre. Williamson has to go. That looked out, however, massive blow for New Zealand. They haven't lost a review, if that's any consolation
short of a length on off, stands tall and fends it back to the bowler
left alone outside offf
full on off, Raval replies with a forward-defensive
pitched up and angling away outside off, left alone
overpitched and outside off, Raval cashes in now. He flows forward and smoothly drives it past the right of mid-off
full, angled in, and then swings away outside off past the outside edge
short of a length and outside off, left alone
bouncer on leg stump, ducks under it

Whoa! One-hander from de Kock. He dives full-length to his right and grabs it in front of first slip. Stunner! Rabada and de Kock combine to send Broom back for a duck on debut. Rabada follows two short balls with a good-length ball. Angled in at off - perfect line and length - and then seams away outside off, Broom is squared up. Takes the outside edge, the ball seemed destined to die in front of first slip.... until de Kock flung himself to his right. Rabada has two wickets without even conceding a run. It would not have carried to Amla
full-toss down the leg side, grazes the pad and sneaks away fine on the leg side
another rare error from Rabada. Leg-stump ball, flicked away through square leg
full and angling away outside off, left alone
full and outside off, poked through the cover-point region
just short of a good length on a fourth-stump line, blunted to cover
back of a length on the hips, hangs back and clips the ball down to long leg
length ball, angled in, Raval closes the face early, leading-edges it to the right of backward point
back of a length and angled into the hips, glanced to long leg. NZ get a reprieve. Drinks

appeal for lbw, not given by umpire Dharmasena. Review first-up after drinks. This seemed to pitch outside leg, if not, definitely heading down leg. Pitched up, nips back in, beats the inside edge and hits the front pad as Raval plays all around it. The tracker confirms it pitched outside leg
pitches outside leg, hits the thigh, and lobs to short leg
just short of a good length on leg stump, defended to short leg
good length, starts on off, and seams away past the outside edge
pitched up and slanting away outside off, Raval tightens up and leaves
length and outside off, Raval watches it through to the keeper
starts with a loose half-volley outside off, real gift, Nicholls laps it up and push-drives it through the covers on the front foot
very full and nailed it at off stump, Raval jabs it hard onto the ground via an open face past point's right
good length on off, pushed to mid-off
pretty full and angled in, Raval aims an off drive, the ball comes in, takes the inside edge and wanders away in the direction of mid-on
back of a length, angled in at off, then straightens away. Another ripper from Morne. Raval dangles his bat out before pulling it away from the channel
another half-volley outside off, Raval stretches forward, meets the pitch, and drives elegantly past the covers again. This yields only three
lifter on the leg stump, ducks under it
back of a length on off, blocked back from the crease
just short of a good length and slanting away outside off, left alone
Raval is picking off these half-volleys. Over pitched on leg stump, put away through midwicket for a boundary
there's the sucker ball, full and wide outside off, Raval chases it with his hands and is beaten in the channel
this isn't a half-volley by any means. Length ball on off, punchily driven straight of mid-off. The ball skips away and hides itself behind the boundary. Shot of the morning so far
left alone outside off
short and angled in from around the wicket, Nicholls falls over to the off side and takes a blow on his hip
back of a length and holds its line outside off, nothing doing from Nicholls
full on off, compactly defended on the front foot
much shorter and angled in at off, Nicholls stands tall and fends it back to the bowler
short and kicks up outside off, safely fended to point
full and holds its line on off, tip-and-run single to cover. It's a double actually, Bavuma springs to his left from point, but misses a direct hit at the non-striker's end, and concedes an overthrow
menacing short ball, angling away outside off, Raval drops his gloves and sways his upper body out of the way of harm
banged in short around off, bursts off the deck, fended back to the bowler on the back foot
short ball on the leg stump, tucks the left-hander up for room. He looks to work the ball to leg, closes the bat-face early, and flaps it in front of point
short of a length on leg stump, hangs back and fends it to the right of short leg
keeps it short, angling away outside off, hops and fends it to point
good length, bounces, angled in to hit the pad, not threatening the stumps with the angle from around the wicket
full and angled in on off, prods and inside-edges it onto the pad as the ball rolls to the off side
137ks short ball outside off, Nicholls rocks his head out of the way
Morkel bangs it on a back of a length outside off, angled in, straightens away. The batsman follows the ball with a hard-handed jab and gets away. Beaten
pitched up, this is angled in at off, Nicholls is not close to the pitch but drives. The outside edge streaks away to the right of Bavuma at backward point
deliciously half-volley on the pads, Nicholls tucks into it, literally and figuratively, and places it square of long leg
full and swinging into the pads, glanced to long leg for one
Rabada keeps peppering Raval with the short stuff, fizzes off the deck, swings late, and thuds into the gloves of the keeper. Left alone by the batsman
dug short and outside off, Raval watches it through to de Kock again
back of a length and angled in, does not threaten off stump, left alone
back of a length and skidding through outside off, Raval thought about having a crack at it.... before belatedly letting it pass
short on a sixth-stump line outside off, left alone again
back of a length and angled in, perilously close to the off stump, tight leave
overpitched and outside off, Nicholls leans into it and drives it delightfully to the right of extra cover
Morkel pulls his length back, angled in, defended
Morne runs in hard, hits the deck harder, sends down a lifter, Nicholls ducks under it
Edged and does not carry to gully. Back of a length, angled in, and curves away. Finds the outside edge and lands in front of Duminy
back of a length and largely holds its line on off, played back to the bowler
full and angled in just outside off, left alone
full and holds its line outside off, Raval is well aware of his off stump and lets it pass
short and angled in at off, shuffles across and fends to leg
short and angled in at off again, Raval ventures back and across in defence again
full and hung up on a fifth-stump line, Raval stretches forward and leaves
length ball outside off, rears up, but Raval is unperturbed. Does the leaving dance again
slides on with the arm on off, might full, squeezed back to Duminy
pitched up and rolls on off again, forward-defensive
skids on outside off, flatter, chopped to backward point
back of a length on off, no turn, leans back and punches to the same fielder
non-turning offbreak on off, defended back with a straight bat
full on the stumps, 88.2ks, blocked to midwicket
short and outside off, rocks back and miscues a pull to midwicket
back of a length and angled in, defended to leg
length and outside off, Raval shoulders arms
full and angled in on off, forward and played back down the pitch
left alone outside off
another maiden. No runs off the last 19 balls as Raval leaves another one in the channel
flighted on off, drives and skews to mid-on off the inside half
full and rolls on off, push-driven to mid-off on the front foot
really full on leg stump, whipped out to midwicket on the back foot
flat and speared on off, dug back to Duminy
dropped short and outside off, skips back and cuts to sweeper for one. First runs after 24 balls
looped up on off, no turn for Duminy, blocked on the front foot
full and angled in on off, tip and run to mid-on. Good running from NZ
back of a length and angled in, played to the cordon with soft hands
very full on off, flicked away in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
floated up outside off, a bit too full, 126ks, Nicholls leans forward and drives it past extra cover, the ball purrs away to the fence. The outfield has got quicker
nip-backer from Philander, starts outside off and veers in, Nicholls pushes at the ball and squirts an inside edge onto the pad

edged and it flies away to the left of a diving Amla at first slip. Lobbed up very wide outside off, drifts in the air, and turns, Raval throws his bat at a drive, and the outside edge streaks away to the third man fence
left alone outside off

edged to Amla at slip. That should be lunch on the first day. Perfect end to the session for South Africa. Maharaj hangs it up in the air. Dangled up outside off. This one holds its line, Raval anticipates the turn, pushes at the ball away from the body with hard hands, knee-high catch for Amla. Until this moment, Raval had showed good judgement outside off
slides on outside off, no turn, Neesham lets it pass
flatter and this spins back in, defended to short leg on the back foot
back of a length and on the hips, Nicholls camps back and clips it down to long leg. Easily done
good length, swings back in late, kisses the flap of the back pad on its way to the keeper. It did not nip back enough. Neesham simply padded up to the bat
short on off, Neesham ventures back and across in defence
full on the stumps, played into the leg side
good length, swerving away, very close to the off stump, forces Neesham to play at it. He prods and is beaten lavishly
much fuller and wider, angling away further, left alone
loose ball on the pads, confidently picked off to short leg's right, clipped through midwicket
banged in short, angled in at off stump, Neesham hops and fends it to the left of short leg
short and attached with width. Nicholls has a proper go at it. Flays it over the top. Wide of backward point
back of a length and angled in, inside-edged behind square on the leg side
dug short and aimed at the body, fended to leg
short and wide outside off, bounces at Nicholls. He does not care. He throws his bat at the ball and flashes this over the top of the cordon for another boundary
short on middle, barely rises up to the chest, deflected to long leg
short and angling across off, the left-hander protects his off stump and lets it pass
short and angled in at off from around the stumps, blunted onto the pitch
just short of a good length on a seventh-stump line, he flashed over the top in the previous over. This time he opts to shoulder arms
back of a length and slanted in on off, defended to cover
full on off, firmly driven back to Rabada
good length and outside off, Neesham opens the face and the ball runs past gully off an outside edge. No third man to cut that off. Third boundary off Morkel after the break
clipped off the pads to long leg
back of a length on leg stump, Nicholls hops, misses the flick. Takes the thigh and squirts to square leg
short and wide outside off - such balls are travelling to the boundary - angled across, Neesham shifts his balance onto the back foot and powers a pull to the left of mid-on
pitched up and slanting across off, Neesham plays back, fiddles with it and watches the ball beat the outside edge
overpitched on the stumps, fifth four off Morkel in two overs after lunch, Neesham does not press forward. Instead, camps back and whips through mid-on. NZ pass 100
short of a length and just a shade outside off, fended on the back foot
full and angled in, defended to leg
rising short ball outside off, bursts off the deck, Nicholls hops, skips, and gloves it in the air to the left of point
worked from off stump to square leg
length and on a fifth-stump line, covers his off stump and lets it go
big lifter on the leg stump, ducks under it
tossed outside off, kneels low and sweeps it to square leg's right. Tumbling save from the fielder
short and outside off, goes back and punches the ball to the covers
short dart on off, defended on the back foot to midwicket

an appeal for stumping, de Kock seems confident. Neesham walks off. NZ five down. Tossed outside off, Neesham, who has been happy hanging back until now, looks to stretch forward. He overbalances and his back foot slips out of the crease. De Kock capitalises, swiping the bails off. Maharaj returns and strikes
flighted on off, blocked with a straight bat
full on the stumps, played back to the bowler
full-toss on off from around the stumps, punched away straight of mid-off
clipped off the pads to the right of long leg for a double
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Nicholls swishes his bat out of the way
back of a length and wider outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, tapped into the cover-point region for a quick sone
length and wider than a set of stumps outside off, left alone
dangled up on middle, stretches across the line of the stumps, rolls his wrists and sweeps to the left of deep square
flighted on off, forward and smothered onto the pitch
darted in on middle and leg, played back to Maharaj
dangled up outside off, just 79ks, Nicholls dashes down the track and dumps it straight over the bowler's head. Brings up his half-century off 66 balls
length and outside off, extra  bounce, Nicholls offers his pad
floaty full ball on off, no turn, defended to cover on the front foot
full and angled in at off, squirted to point off the face
full and just a shade outside off, Watling plays with soft hands, absorbs the pace, and dabs to point
back of a length on a fifth/sixth-stump line outside off, left alone
full on off, resolutely blocked on the front foot
back of a length and outside off, leans back and handsomely punches to point
cracking ball from Rabada. Very full, angled in at off, and cunningly cuts away past the outside edge
tossed outside off, down the track and driven down to long-on
very full and angled in on off, whipped more or less straight to midwicket
non-turning full ball on middle, blocked with a straight bat
full on off again, forward-defensive
short hurrying ball on off, back-foot force to cover
swept from off stump. Swept firmly to the square boundary. Watling gets off the mark after 14 balls
bouncer, 135.3ks, ducks under
short and angled in from around the stumps, camps back and works it to the left of mid-on
full and angled in, left alone just outside off
left alone outside off again
back of a length and holds its line in the channel, Watling watches it through to the keeper
tight line on off, angled out to the cordon
slides on outside off, left alone
full and angling away outside off, no stroke offered
full on middle and leg, pushed to Rabada who hangs back at mid-on after a lengthy spell
that's a beauty! Good length, angled in, hits the deck, then screams away outside off. Beats the outside edge, beats the off stump. Unplayable
fullish on off, played back to the bowler
pitched up on off, Watling is solid in defence
short of a length and outside off, gets on top of the bounce and jabs the ball to cover
skids on wide outside off, Nicholls jerks his pad out
shortish and spins in on off, punched back to the bowler
fired wide outside off, he offers his pad
dangled up wide outside off, kicks it away with the pad
tossed outside off, more padding from Nicholls
flatter and faster outside off, punched back to the bowler on the back foot
back of a length and outside off, tapped to gully
back of a length and outside, jabbed to the cordon
Philander finds seam movement and beats the outside edge
short and outside off, gets on top of the bounce and solidly punches to cover
tight line on off, defended
full on off, forward-defensive
flighted outside off, stretches forward and drills it to one of the two short covers
jumps off a length outside off, offers his pad
tossed outside off, miscues a sweep in the air, lands in front of square leg
skids on outside off, punched behind point
tossed on off, Watling uses his feet and drives a single to long-off. Only the second scoring shot in 31 balls
lobbed up on off, no turn, bends forward and smothers it onto the pitch
back of a length and outside off, dabbed to cover
good length and just a shade outside off, deflected to slip with soft hands
short on off, Watling rises on his toes and fends it behind square
full and outside off, left alone
back of a length on off, defended
starts on off and swings away, Watling judges it well and shoulders arms
down the track, yorks himself, and jabs to mid-off
pitched up on off, driven to mid-off
paddled down to fine leg
Maharaj finds spin but the length is short making things easier for the left-hander. Punched back to the bowler
flighted on off, smothered
short and skids on outside off, bottom-edges a cut past lone slip
good length on off stump, clipped away to square leg
very full and angled into leg stump, Watling topples over the flick and is rapped on the front pad. But this was heading down the leg side
short of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches crisply to cover
back of a length and just outside off, defended
full on off, Watling bends forward in defence
shot. Back of a length and outside off, leans back and crunches it to the cover boundary
tossed outside off, carved away through backward point
drifts in on off, played back to the bowler
ouch, nearly chopped on! Arm ball, slides in on off, Watling employs a defensive shot. The ball spins backwards, rolls past the leg stump
uses his feet, meets the pitch, and clips a single to wide mid-on
tossed outside off, drags a sweep to deep square leg
tossed up on off, forward and defended to the leg side
just short of a good length on off, punched back to the bowler
pitched further up and slanting across off, Nicholls covers his off stump and shoulders arms
good length, angling across, bounces, hits the splice and rolls to point
good length on middle and leg, tip and run to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Watling watches it through to the keeper
short of a length, angled in at off, Watling throws his bat in front of his chest and negotiates it
Nicholls comes down the track and drives to Cook at short cover
uses his feet again, this time he drives it to the right of short cover for a quick single. Extra cover swoops down on the ball but they pinch one
pitched up on off, Watling bends forward and runs this back to the bowler
paddled from outside off to long leg. Watling placed it wide enough of leg gully
tossed outside off, now it's Nicholls' turn to sweep to deep square leg
down the track, manufactures a half-volley on off and shovels it to short cover
really full and angling away outside off, Nicholls shelves the drive and leaves
full on off, whisked between midwicket and mid-on
135.2ks bouncer outside off, Watling evades it
full and hurtles in to strike the thigh as Watling does not connect with a flick, playing around his front pad
nip-backer from Morkel, starts outside off and veers in, Watling has a crease-bound flash and is beaten on the inside edge
full on middle and leg, knocked into the leg side for another speedy single
very full and attacking off, defended back to Maharaj
keeps it full, drifts in on middle, defended back again
tossed on off, forward and pushed back to the bowler
slides on with the arm, played into the leg side
Watling goes for the sweep but misses. He is rapped on the pad outside the line of off stump
just short of a good length on off, Nicholls hangs back and blocks it back to Morkel
good length on middle and leg, Nicholls presses forward and pushes the ball to mid-on
pitched up and angling away outside off, Nicholls thought about going after it before belatedly pulling out
much wider outside off, left alone
full and sliding away outside off, grazes the edge and rolls down to third man
full and straight, tickled towards fine leg
flat and outside off, forced back to Maharaj on the back foot
even flatter and outside off, punched into the off side
Watling skips out and backs away outside leg, yorks himself and jams it to cover
tossed on middle, pushed back to the bowler
fired outside off, eased to mid-off
tossed on off, knocked to midwicket, good set of six balls from Maharaj
bouncer, angling away outside off, Nicholls has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it
back of a length and angling away outside off, punched crisply to mid-off, where Rabada gets across and lets it through his legs
back of a length and on the hips, deftly glanced away through square leg
overpitched outside off, Watling leans into it and regally drives it through the covers. Takes it on the up and dispatches Morkel
back of a length and outside off, Watling now watches it through to de Kock
full and nips back in, suspect Watling managed an inside edge onto the pad
pushed through short on middle, blocked to leg on the back foot
uses his feet and drives it to long-off, where Morkel makes a tumbling save
full on middle, calmly defended back on the front foot
slides on a fourth-stump line, defended
uses his feet and drives inside-out to deep mid-off
full and angled across off, Nicholls responds with a long stride. Played back to the bowler
back of a length on top of off, Watling is solid in defence
full on off, blocked on the front foot
rising short ball outside off, fended to cover
length and outside off, Watling strides forward, drives on the up and finds mid-off
back of a length on off, Watling blocks resolutely, head over the ball
pitched up and outside off, Watling moves forward and caresses a drive straight of Philander at mid-off
tossed up on off, Nicholls runs down the track and drives back to the bowler
short on off, stays back and whips to midwicket
floated up outside off, Nicholls nips down the track and shovels it over midwicket
tossed outside off, Nicholls unfurls the sweep now, places it square through the leg side
looped up on off, Watling presses forward and defends it back to the bowler
back of a length and fired in, bunted to mid-on on the back foot
short of a length and holds its line outside off, left alone
back of a length and on the hips, Nicholls stands tall and punches the ball to midwicket
dug short and outside off, rides the bounce and pulls to long leg
short and skids in, worked to square leg
tossed on off, defended
short and outside off, forced back to the bowler
goes low, sweeps from outside off to deep square leg
very full on the stumps, whipped to midwicket
down the track and wristily driven to short cover. Duminy slips, throws at the keeper's end, instead of the bowler's end. Nicholls is home comfortably
dragged short and spins back in, stands tall and punches to long-on
just short of a good length and angling across off, nothing doing from Nicholls
shorter on off, fended back to the bowler
pitched up and angling away outside off, left alone again
short and too wide outside off, no shot offered
straying onto the hips. Nicholls sits back and does not connect with a flick
short, angled in on off, safely negotiated. Fended back to Rabada
clipped off the pads to square-ish long leg
uses his feet and drives it back to Maharaj
looped up wide outside off, Nicholls kicks it away with his pad
full-toss outside off, Nicholls latches onto it, swishing the ball between mid-off and extra cover
full and slides on off, played back to the bowler
short of a length and on a fourth-stump line, defended on the back foot
rare loose shot from Watling. Good length and nips away outside off, Watling is pinned to the crease as he flashes and misses outside off
back of a length and wider outside off,Watling tightens and lets it pass
nip-backer from Rabada after a brace of away-going deliveries. Surprises Watling who chops an inside edge past the leg stump
short and zipping through outside off, Watling looks to flay it through the covers. Only connects with thin air
wide half-volley, Watling springs onto it, cracking a drive through the covers. Hit on the up
length and outside off, ignored
tossed up full, drifts in, Nicholls steps outside leg and inside-edges it fine on the off side, past lone slip
skids on outside off, punched back to the bowler
short, angled in, clipped to leg
short and outside off, Nicholls is quick to pick the length up. Rocking back and cutting to sweeper
flighted outside off, drifts away, grazes the outside edge and drops in front of point
full non-turning offbreak outside off, which is sweetly punched to long-on
just short of a good length, angled in, and tails away outside off. Watling jabs at it before pulling his bat inside the line
good length and largely holds its line outside off, left alone now
really full, and angled in on off, Watling presses forward and drives back to the bowler
132ks bouncer on middle, Watling sinks under it
back of a length and goes away outside off, Watling simply watches it through to the keeper
length-ball inswinger, beats the inside edge and raps the pad, but this was going down leg
skids on, too close to off for a cut. Beaten outside off
tossed up and angled in, Nicholls gets forward and blocks towards midwicket
straight ball on middle, nurdled square through the leg side
jumps off a length outside off, topspinner?, Watling spars at it and misses
another flat dart outside off, left alone
full at off stump, flicked past the left of mid-on for three. Nicholls enters the nineties
good length, shapes like an inswinger and then seams away outside off, well left
just short of a good length and outside off, Watling plays late and guides the ball to gully
full tempter outside off, Watling isn't tempted
good length and on a fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball, jumps off the surface, no shot offered
full on off as Nicholls uses his feet and smoothly pushes the ball to cover, despite the ball dipping on him
skids on with the arm, Watling shuffles across the off stump and dinks it to midwicket
full, drifts in, takes the inside edge and rolls to midwicket
pushed through outside off, ignored
pitched up and outside off, eased to cover
too wide outside off to draw a stroke
full and wider than a set of stumps outside off, Nicholls reaches out for the ball with hard hands and carves it away between gully and backward point. Equals his best score in Test cricket
good length and wide outside off, Nicholls leaves it be this time

Maiden Test hundred for Nicholls! Excellent knock under pressure. Arrived at 21 for 3 and has fashioned a recovery. He soaks in the applause from his team-mates and the Wellington crowd. Banged in short and outside off, Nicholls dares to hook and hits it firmly over square leg. Has he sewed up the No.5 spot in Tests?
back of a length and outside off, Nicholls jabs away from the body and edges it thickly between slips and gully
pitched up and outside off, leans into it and caresses the ball through the covers
good length, angled in on off, defended
dropped short and wide outside off, cracked to sweeper cover
speared outside off, beats the cut
Watling leans back and late-cuts to point
slides on with the arm outside off, left alone
length and outside off, no turn, defended to cover
too full for the sweep, drags the ball to square leg
pitched up and outside off, left alone
full on off, forward-defensive
lifter outside off, big bouncer, ducks under it. Too high and called wide
short of a length on off, punched back down the pitch
very full on middle and leg, pushed away on the front foot past the left of mid-on. Nicholls timed the pants off this
overpitched and outside off, Nicholls brings out another quality drive, places it straight of mid-on
full, wide tempter, Nicholls chases and misses
looped up outside off, bunted to long-on on the front foot
full on off, uses his feet and does not get to the pitch. Wafts back to the bowler

Duminy finds a way a past Nicholls. He walks back to a rousing reception. De Grandhomme pats him on the back. Pushed through faster, drifts in the air, and turns away. Nicholls shimmies out and yorks himself as he aims to work it to the leg side. The ball hits the top of off stump
half-volley outside off, de Grandhomme laces a drive to deep cover
fired outside off, left alone
length and outside off, left alone
short of a length and outside off, stabbed to cover
pretty close to off, seams in, tight leave
good length and outside off, ignored
back of a length, curves in, hits the pad, beating the batsman's attempt to nudge to leg
full and outside off, Watling is late to pull his bat away, slides off the face to the cordon

Two wickets in two overs for Duminy from nowhere! NZ picked Grandhomme to bolster the batting, he gives his wicket away. De Grandhomme runs down the track, Duminy is wary of it as he drags his length back and sends it wide outside off. The batsman looks to belt it through the covers. Takes the outside edge, deflects off the keeper's gloves, and Amla pouches another smart catch to his right at slip
full and outside off, driven to cover
left alone outside off
short and outside off, left alone
wide outside off, ignored again
slides on outside off, he lets it pass again
full and outside off, front-foot drive to mid-off
good length on a fourth-stump line, played back to the bowler
short and outside off, Southee rocks back and swishes to mid-on
banged in short outside off, Southee shelves the upper cut/hook. Square leg in the deep
good length on off, played back to the bowler
a beauty from Philander to finish the over. Full, angled in, and nips away. Southee pokes and misses outside off...or not. RTS detects a spike. Thin nick and Southee gets away. SA did not appeal

an appeal for caught behind. They refer it to the TV umpire. The soft signal from umpire Tucker is not out. Tossed-up offbreak from Duminy. Watling shapes to sweep. He only manages an under-edge, which kisses the front pad. Then bounces onto the flap of the back pad, which is on the ground as he knelt low on the sweep. The ball balloons up with de Kock just about clutching the ball against his chest. It sticks. What an unfortunate way to go. Three wickets in three overs for Duminy!
flighted and outside off, slices a drive to deep point
speared outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, chopped to cover
length and outside off, left alone
full and outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
lifter just outside off, Patel yanks his head out of the way
full and outside off, Southee slinks outside leg and chips it over extra cover
dragged short and outside off, Southee smashes a pull to the midwicket boundary
Southee pre-mediates, ventures across off, and slugs this length ball to long leg
shortish and very wide outside off, Southee cuts and an outside edge scoots to third man
tossed up and drifts away outside off, biffed away over extra cover
floated up outside off, Patel shows Southee how to clear the boundary. Down the track and launches over mid-off
quicker and flatter outside off, left alone
down the track and laced to the left of deep point
dropped short and outside off, flat-batted away to the right of Cook at deep point now
banged in short and angling away outside off, Southee backs away, ramps and does not connect
short on the leg stump, Southee swings wildly and misses again
keeps it short and angling away outside off, Southee arches his back and leaves this
swatted off the hips to long leg
short and outside off, Patel gets inside the line and swats it away again, this time fine of leg gully
short and rises on off, he rides the bounce and drops the ball to cover
slides on outside off, Southee cuts and misses
that's the good ol' Sixer Southee. Tossed outside off, he clears his front leg and sends the ball clattering into the grass banks beyond the straight boundary
this is even better! Slower and full outside off, Southee stretches forward and lifts it through the line. Puts the ball over the sightscreen
no hat-trick of sixes for Southee. Fired across off from around the wicket, flashed to cover
one-bounce four. Pushed across off from around the wicket, hammered in the air straight of long-on
just short of a good length on off, backs away and punches to point. Maharaj has a shy at the bowler's end. Nobody backing up, and SA gift a single
short of a length and outside off, Southee, having pre-meditated,  shuffles across off and misses
Philander jogs across to his right from mid-on and settles under a skier. Pitched full on middle, Southee backs away outside leg and miscues a loft. Sparking cameo, nevertheless
very full on middle, squeezed out
banged down leg, Patel gets inside the line and leaves
bouncer on off, ducks under it
dropped short and outside off, late cut away fine of backward point

Wagner has been given out lbw. He calls for a review, this looks out. Tossed up, drifts in and pings the front pad, beating the inside edge. Wagner played all around his front pad. Pitched in line, impact in line, hitting leg. All three reds and Duminy wraps up NZ for 268
full outswinger outside off, left alone
full inswinger into the pads, flicked through square leg
length and swings away outside off, glided to gully
pitched up on middle, nips away, squares up Cook, who pokes to the covers
short and wide outside off, Cook lets it pass
lovely delivery. On a length, angled in, and swings away. Cook is pinned to the crease. He has a feeble prod and misses
back of a length, starts outside off and nibbles in, defended back to the bowler
very full and wide outside off, Elgar lets it go
leg-stump ball, tucked to square leg
back of a length and angling across off, ignored
nudged to the left of mid-on for a single
very full and angling across off, Elgar plays with an angled bat and squirts an outside edge between gully and backward point
pitched up and outside off, Elgar closes the bat-face and drives it straight past the bowler
poked to the right of backward point
full and just a shade outside off, Elgar pushes a long way in front of his body as the ball dribbles to mid-off
very full and angling across off, driven between backward point and gully
good length and angled in just outside off, left alone
back of a length on the hips, deflected behind square
very full on middle, blocked back to the bowler on the front foot
on a length and angling across off, Elgar covers his off stump and leaves
back of a length, hint of inward movement, wafted back to the bowler
short and aimed at the armpit, Cook ventures across off and fends it off awkwardly
full and hung up outside off, ignored
full awayswinger, gets forward and pushes it to the covers

edged and taken by Neesham! Southee ventures wide of the crease, gets it to angle in, then swing away. Cook is nowhere near the pitch of this ball. He simply throws his his hands at a drive and the outside edge flies to second slip
short and outside off, nothing doing from Rabada
back of a length and wide outside off, left alone. Wicket maiden from Southee
back of a length, starts outside off, and seams back in, left alone
full and really wide outside off, Elgar leaves

Edged and taken low by Neesham at second slip again! South Africa's openers have been dismissed inside six overs. Much fuller and outside off, Elgar would have been better off had he left it. Instead, he chases the ball with his hands like Cook did. Neesham gulps down the outside edge
length ball, starts outside off and moves away, left alone
back of a length and angled in on off, worked to leg on the back foot
awayswinger, no shot offered
what a beauty from Southee! Full, starts outside off, rips in, beats the inside edge, bounces over the leg stump, and beats the keeper
full, angled in, and straightens away outside off, no shot offered
length and outside off, Rabada arches back and late-cuts it, threading the cordon
short of a length and angled in from around the stumps, Rabada jumps and leaves
banged in short, bursts off the deck, Rabada yanks his head out of the way
low full-toss angled in on middle and leg, driven through mid-on for a boundary, and that's stumps on the first day
puts it on a good length outside off and finds some away movement. Amla employs soft hands, plays late, dabbing the ball to point
good length and largely holds its line outside off, too wide to draw a stroke from Amla
gentle awayswinger in the corridor from over the wicket, Amla lets it go
shorter on a fifth-stump line outside off, Amla hoists his bat above his shoulder and ignores it
really full and wide outside off, asks Amla to drive. He does not bite

back of a length, starts outside off, nips back in to beat the inside edge and ping the back thigh of Amla, who was eyeing up the leg side with a flick. He weathers the lbw appeal. Umpire Dharmasena shakes his head. It would have been bouncing over the stumps
pitches it full and outside off, swings away, Rabada does not account for the movement. Drives with no feet and skews an inside edge to the midwicket region
fuller and swinging down leg, past the glance
nice curving outswinger outside off, Amla covers his off stump and shoulders arms
on a length and nibbles away outside off, sits back and glides it in the gap at point. Amla opens his account after 12 balls

got 'em! Southee strikes in the second over of the day. Rabada, the nightwatchman, has to go. Pretty full from Southee, swings back into the left-hander, who aims to flick the ball to leg. Brushes the front pad and hits the stumps
whizzes past the outside edge. Full, angling away, swinging away outside off. Duminy drives away from the body and misses
back of a length and holds its line outside off, nothing doing from Amla
full and outside off, no shot offered
wide of the crease, angled in, and curls away outside off, more leaving from Amla
pitched up on off, Amla presses forward and bunts it to cover
short and climbs through just outside off, Amla ignores again
mighty full, angled in at off, dug out. Back-to-back maidens for de Grandhomme
nice and full on middle, Duminy shuffles across and plays it back to the bowler
short on off, fended to leg
full, angling away, swinging away outside off, Duminy pushes away from the body. An inside edge streaks away behind square on the leg side
full and sliding down leg, Amla looks to glance it fine. No dice
this one hits the deck and leaps at Amla, leaves him in a tangle. Chest-high lifter. Fended off the glove to leg
full tempter outside off, left alone by Amla
full on off, solidly pushed to cover on the front foot
back of a length and around off, fended back
on a good length on a set of stumps outside off, Duminy watches it through to the keeper
full and wide outside off, Duminy does not bother with it
very full and angled in on middle and leg, Amla pushes a single to the left of mid-on
just short of a good length and slanting away outside off, takes the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat but does not carry to the cordon
too wide outside off to draw a shot from Duminy
very full and closer to off, opens the bat-face and drives to point
Southee tests Duminy with a short ball outside off, the batsman is late onto the pull, toe-ending it to mid-on
back of a length and angling away outside off, Duminy gets on top of the bounce, punching the ball to point with an angled bat
on a length and plugs away outside off, Amla shoulders arms
the bowler ventures wide of the crease, angled in, but goes too full on off, Amla presses forward and elegantly drives it straight of Williamson at mid-off
pulls his length back outside off, left alone
leg-side ball, duly glanced to long leg
half-tracker attached with width outside off, Duminy does not need any second invitations. Rocks back and flays a cut through the covers
short and wide outside off, he errs in length again, this is cut away fine of backward point. Purrs away to the boundary
tight line and length, defended on the front foot
left alone outside off
back of a length, on top of off, defended back to the bowler

chest-high short ball on off, Amla does not flinch. He swivels on the back foot, rises on top of the bounce, and pulls it strongly over square leg. No protection in the deep. Amla moves to double figures
banged in short on middle, pulled away again, Wagner now cuts it off at long leg
back of a length and angling across off, squeezed between backward point and gully
back of a length and zipping away outside off, left alone
good length and angling away outside off, left alone again
short and angling away wide outside off, Amla has a crack at it. Cutting it square for another boundary
Amla jumps across off, this one is angled further away from him in the corridor. Ignored
really full and wide outside off, Wagner asks Amla to drive. He does not bite
clipped off the hips to long leg
wide of the crease, angled in at off, swings away, grazes the outside edge and rolls down to gully
on a length and outside off, Amla jumps across off and leaves
full and homing in on off, nurdled to the left of short leg
left alone outside off
nice and full outside off, Duminy leans into the drive. Caressed to wide mid-off on the up
Southee ventures wide of the crease. This holds its line outside off. Amla leaves it be

What have you done, Duminy? Soft as wax. Loose leg-stump half-volley, loose shot from the batsman. Falls over to the off side and simply chips into the hands of Nicholls at short midwicket. Wagner removes Duminy for the third time this series.
short on off, 138.6ks, punched into the covers
short and wide outside off, Faf fetches it from there and swats it away between midwicket and mid-on
short and hammered on off, Amla hops and fends
full and angling across off, left alone
shuffles across and whips an off-stump ball to square leg
short and outside off, punched to mid-off on the back foot
full and angled in on off, draws Faf forward. Pushed down to mid-on
really full, angled in towards off, and nibbles away really late. Faf does well to shoulder arms. Good judgement
ventures short on off, blunted to cover on the back foot
wide of the crease, angled in and swings away, Faf does not go after it again. Excellent bowling from Southee. Posing question after question to SA
wide of the crease again, swerves in on off, really full, picked off to square leg
full and angling across off, Amla leaves it be
overpitched at off stump, swings in a touch, 138ks, Amla shifts his balance onto the front foot and drills a drive between the bowler and Faf. Glorious timing
Wagner drags his length back outside off, left alone
good length and veering away outside off, Amla covers his off stump and ushers the ball to Watling
deflected off the hips to long leg
goes wide of the crease again, angled at leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
just short of a good length on off, Faf stands tall and punches the ball to mid-off
good length on off, tapped back down the pitch
full and outside off, Faf shelves the booming cover drive
full on a set of stumps outside off, maybe even wider, left alone. Drinks. SA 200 behind
full and attacking off, Amla's solid defence intervenes
full on off, Amla shuffles across off and works the ball to leg
Wagner does his thing. Runs hard. Hits the deck harder. Bangs a bouncer. Amla ducks under
back of a length on off, shuffles across in defence
just short of a good length on off. Amla answers with a straight bat
lifter on middle, 135.2ks, Amla ducks out of the way
full, angled in, and then shapes away outside off. Faf does well not to follow the curve of the ball
another outswinger from wide of the crease, Faf isn't bothered again
full and angled into the pads, twirls his wrists and clips to long leg
Amla shimmies out and yorks himself. This swings away, jammed out square on the off side
full and comes in on middle and leg, walks across off and blocks in front of mid-on
wide of the crease, full on the stumps, bunted to mid-on
half-volley outside off, begging on its knees to be put away. Faf does that in style. Drives it on the up
back of a length and angling away outside off, left alone
just short of a good length and slanting away outside off, run away to point
length and angling across off, no shot offered
short and angling across off, jabbed to gully
shoulder-high short ball just outside off, Faf takes it on. Attempts a pull and sees the top edge clear long leg
pitched up on a fifth-stump line, left alone
full and this nibbles away, another monk-like leave from Amla
left alone outside off again

another soft dismissal. What's with these leg-stump half-volleys this morning? Southee set it up, de Grandhomme strikes. Nicholls grabs it on the rebound at short midwicket. Amla slowly drags himself off the field. Too full on the pads, Amla picks it up and chips it in the air. Amla played too early. Nicholls leaps to his left, juggles, and completes a fine catch even as his elbow hit the ground
full and outside off, left alone
much wider outside off, ignored
ripping bouncer, flies off the deck, beats Faf's attempted hook
left alone outside off
full and angling across off, left alone
hip-high short ball, swatted to long leg
full and skipping away outside off, Bavuma shoulders arms wisely
pitched up and angling across off, draws a big drive from Bavuma, and goes past the outside edge
on a length on off, defended
pitched up on a fifth-stump line, Faf watches it through to the keeper
half-tracker outside off, stops on Faf, flashed through the covers
full on off, Bavuma flows forward and drives to mid-off
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
swings in on off, played back to the bowler
hip-high short ball on off, swatted to deep midwicket
shorter and fizzing across off, left alone
full and angling away outside off, Bavuma moves forward, meets the pitch, and punchily drives through the covers. Gets off the mark after nine balls
pitched up, hint of swing, pushed to mid-off
driven on the up to mid-off
short on off, fended in front of his feet
full and heading down leg, Faf misses the flick
full and holds its line outside off, ignored
keeps it full and just outside off, Faf keeps leaving
short and outside off, Faf has a slash at it, hit to point
length and outside off, run down to gully
left alone outside off
pitched up and outside off, left alone
short, kicks up and screams away outside off, Bavuma jumps off his feet, upper cuts and only connects with thin air
Bavuma rises on top of the bounce of this short ball outside off and punches through the covers
short on off, hangs back and shovel-pulls to deep midwicket

top-edge and it drops into no-man's land between midwicket and mid-on. Big bouncer outside off, Bavuma has to fetch it from there. He skies a pull and de Grandhomme at mid-on loses his footing. Had he remained stable he could have snaffled a catch
short and outside off, Faf now controls a pull to the right of deep midwicket
good length and angled in on off, solidly pushed to mid-on on the front foot
glanced off the pads to long leg

De Grandhomme nabs Faf and celebrates with his team-mates. SA six down. The morning keeps getting better for NZ. Inside-edged behind to the keeper. <s> menacing leg-stump half-volley</s>. Very full and wide outside off, this is an impatient shot from Faf. Nothing shot, in fact. Reaches out for the ball with his hands, drives, and sends a healthy nick behind. Top catch from Watling, though. He was pre-meditating, moving to his right, then adjusted, taking the catch to his left. That he had to change directions made it difficult. And he completed the catch without any fuss
full and angled in on off, played back
swish and a miss outside off
slipping down leg, the batsman misses the flick
short and outside off, crunched through the covers
short and angling across off, left alone
lifter just outside off, Bavuma evades it
good length and holds its line outside off, left alone
left alone outside off again
Wagner bangs it short, Bavuma is hurried onto a hook. Top-edges it over the keeper
dropped short and wide outside off, de Kock punches to point, where Raval fumbles
slides in with the arm on middle, defended
straight ball on middle, played back to the bowler
down the track, beaten in the air, driven to cover
uses his feet again, this is pushed straight to midwicket
92ks fizzer, hurries onto de Kock, who backs away, cuts and sees the ball bounce over the stumps. Nearly played on
back of a length and wide outside off, Bavuma watches it through to the keeper
back of a length and angled in just a shade outside off, Bavuma leaves again
good length on off, Bavuma lets it slide off the face to point. There is a mix-up between the wickets but Bavuma has enough time to undo his steps
banged short and outside off, Bavuma drops his gloves and lets it go
pitched up at off, front-foot drive to cover
floaty full ball on middle, nurdled to square leg
pushed through on middle, driven to the right of the bowler
de Kock uses his feet, Jeetan drags his length back. Gently pushed to cover
tossed outside off, drifts in the air, takes the inside edge and squirts wide of leg slip
de Kock backs away, Jeetan fires a dart following the moving batsman. Punched to cover
Jeetan throws this one up wide outside off, de Kock smears it to deepish mid-off
back of a length and outside off, shapes away late, de Kock makes a late decision to let it go
length and outside off, swings away, de Kock leaves another one
just short of a good length on off, sits back and nudges a single to the left of midwicket
full and veering into the pads, deflected to fine leg
short and wide outside off, Bavuma throws his hands at the ball and miscues an upper cut to point
short and outside off, slapped away on the back foot to square point
slides on with the arm outside off, ignored
full and drifts into the pad, defended square on leg
looped up outside off, de Kock waits for it and drives it with the spin in the gap at cover
de Kock jumps down the track and drills this full ball back to the bowler
drifts in on middle and leg, blocked
short on middle, steps away and forces through the covers
back of a length and angled in on off, Bavuma offers a defensively shot. The ball nearly spins back onto the stumps
back of a length and outside off, jabs a single to point
wild bouncer outside off, bursts off the deck, beats the keeper as de Kock ducks under it. Five wides
de Kock hangs back and works this full, incoming ball through square leg
pretty full and slides in, Bavuma falls over the flick. Might have inside-edged it onto the pad
short and wide outside off, Bavuma loves width. He smites a cut in the air over point
length and outside off, left alone
short on off, backs away and late-cuts it deftly past lone slip
short and outside off, swatted away to midwicket
whipped from outside off to midwicket
straight ball on middle, defended
full on middle and leg, kept out
nice drift, veering into the pad, beating the inside edge
short and angled in on off, Bavuma is right behind it in defence
short and moves away outside off, Bavuma swings his hands at a pull and misses
Bavuma ventures across off, this is pretty full on off, swings away, takes the edge and rolls through point
good length and angled in on off, forward-defensive
bouncer, aimed at the head, rocks it out of the way. Well negotiated
full and darted down leg, Bavuma can't put bat on ball. Flicks and misses
tossed on middle, played up to cover
uses his feet and pushes to cover
short on off, flicked to midwicket on the back foot
down the track, meets a half-volley, and drives with the wrists to long-on
full and quicker outside off, driven to cover
loopier on off, Bavuma dead-bats it
short and width outside off, tonked away to the square boundary. Front-foot cut, violent hit
this one goes all the way! This is all about finesse, though. No violence. Short and wide outside off, de Kock uses the pace of Southee to his advantage and ramps it over the third man boundary
short and climbs outside off, rolls his wrists and controls a pull to deep square
tight line on off, defended to cover
full, angled in from wide of the crease, and straightens away, prodded to cover
flighted on middle, tapped to cover
backs away and jabs to the right of cover
dangled up on a fourth-stump line, forward-defensive
short and just outside off, cracked through cover on the back foot
drifts into the pads, nudged past leg slip
skids on outside off, left alone
bangs it in short, de Kock swivels back and pulls along the ground to deep midwicket
follows the short ball with a very full one on off, clipped to leg
back of a length on off, forward and punched to mid-off
attempted short ball, keeps low, and hits the hip
bouncer outside off, comfortably ducks under it
another lifter outside off, de Kock arches back and drops his gloves, allowing the ball to fly through to Watling
good length and angled down leg, Bavuma misses the flick
chipped in the air to the right of midwicket as Bavuma plays early
full and angled down leg again
full on off, punched to mid-on
sweetly flicked off the toes to deep square
angled in at off, turned to one of the two short midwickets
bang! Hip-high short ball on the leg stump, swatted away in the air over long leg for a six on the back foot
bang bang! Just short of a good length and outside off, de Kock scythes it away on the front foot. Rasping cut. The ball hides itself behind the square boundary
proper bouncer, ducks under it
shortish on off, cramps de Kock for room. Chopped to point
short on off, fended to leg
slammed into the middle of the deck, off-stump line, blunted back to the bowler
short and outside off, creamed to deep cover
good length and angled in, defended back down the pitch
short and outside off, rises on top of the bounce and punches crisply through cover
wide of the crease, angled in full on off, bunted down to mid-on.
pitched up on off, forward and blocked to leg
nice and full on off, de Kock stretches forward and hits it back to the bowler
Wagner errs in length, loose half-volley on the stumps, delectably driven straight past the bowler. De Kock races to a fifty off 55 balls
dinked to short midwicket, where the fielder fumbles, allowing the single. De Kock has deflated the hosts
pitched up and angling across off, driven serenely to mid-off
very full and wide outside off, left alone
very full and outside off, leans into the drive and creams it to extra cover
even fuller and outside off, driven in the air, sweeper tidies up in the deep
full on middle and leg, quite predictably, flicked to midwicket
full on middle and leg, threads the gap, beats all the three men there. Picked away to the left of Neesham who is squarer
bouncer outside off, slips under it
full and outside off, eases it to extra-cover, tumbling save
worked through square leg
back of a length on off, defended
back of a length and outside off, punched out to cover
bouncer on middle, ducks out of the way

Hotspot detects a white blotch, and Williamson has to depart. Twin failures for the home captain too. This was a cracking delivery from Morkel, though.
