short and outside off, 135ks, Raval rocks back and hooks this cross-seamer over square leg. Skips past the practice wickets to the boundary
short and outside off, 141.9ks, late cut to deep third man

De Kock produces another stunner. Flies to the right and takes it in front of Amla at first slip. Déjà vu for Broom. Morkel strikes in the second over after lunch. Good length, angled in, and straightens away just outside off, Broom jabs at it and the outside edge flies, as does de Kock. Two-handed catch from the keeper. He has been sensational behind the stumps. Having said that, Broom would have been better off had he left it alone
wide outside off, left alone
banged in short on leg stump, Nicholls takes evasive action, the ball hits his body and runs down to long leg
short and outside off, punched back
drift and bounce, blocked to cover on the back foot
straight ball on off, Raval brings his bat down the right line
tossed on off, gets forward and smothers it
Maharaj throws this up outside off, ignored
starts outside off and spins back in, Raval hurriedly chops it out
back of a length and angling across off, Nicholls hoists his bat above his shoulder and says all yours to de Kock
steep bounce. Short of a length, explodes off the surface, Nicholls leaps, looks to fend to leg, but is smacked on the glove
much fuller and angling across off, Nicholls lets it go
pitched up and sliding across off, no shot offered again
short on leg stump, Nicholls gets inside the line, rides the bounce, and guides the ball in the direction of long leg
Nicholls jumps off the ground to meet this short ball outside off. Fends to cover and sets off
floated up nicely on off, forward and smothered
full and outside off, pushed into the covers
looped up on off, Raval stretches forward and plays it back to the bowler
Raval uses his feet, but is beaten in the air. Maharaj draws a loose drive to extra cover
really full and outside off, Raval stays nice and stable as he taps this one to cover
short and aimed at the chest, fended to short leg
yet another chest-hunting short ball, Nicholls does well to pat it down in front of forward short leg
short on off, Morne keeps pushing Nicholls back. He gets behind in defence
short of a length and angling across off, Nicholls hops, skips, and fends it towards point
nope, Morne keeps hitting the deck hard, banged in on leg stump, leaves the batsman in an awkward tangle. Balloons off the glove but wide of short leg
short on off, 137ks, Raval attempts to pull, topples over, the ball goes only as far as short leg. An over of short balls ends
stretches outside the line of the stumps, rolls his wrists, and neatly sweeps through backward square leg
looped up on off, straight ball, which is dead batted
jumps down the track, closes the bat-face, and drives to mid-off
tossed up and drifts away outside off, eased through the covers on the front foot
length ball, starts outside off, and spins in, watchfully defended on the back foot
fired outside off, Nicholls thrusts his pad out

dug short and outside off, Raval rises on top of the bounce and middles a pull. Swivels and pulls it to the right of deep square. Terrific execution from Raval. Enough of taking blows on the gloves says Raval
short on middle, but not short enough. Swatted away powerfully to the square leg boundary
that's a steep bouncer. The line is just outside off, defeats the hook, sails over de Kock. Five wides
short of a length on off, fended to the cover-point region
hip-high short ball just outside off, pulled straight to Rabada at deep square leg
banged short and outside off, Nicholls now pulls to the right of Rabada at deep square
just short of a good length and outside off, ignored. Another over of short balls ends

after all that treatment, Nicholls drags a sweep back onto the stumps. New Zealand are four down with five behind. Nicely bowled by Maharaj. Dangles it up wide outside off, this spins back in slightly. Nicholls stretches across, sweeps, and gets a thick inside edge, which disturbs the furniture
short outside off, spins in, blocked on the back foot
tossed outside off, spits off the footmarks and raps the pad outside the line of off. So Neesham weathers the lbw appeal
fired on off, Neesham goes low and hammers a sweep to the midwicket boundary
hurled short and outside off, spins in, chopped out

Faf leaps at midwicket and pulls off another one-hander. Gee! He makes it look super easy. Looped up outside off, Neesham dares to step down the track, but isn't close to the pitch. He shovels across the line, and Faf plucks it out of thin air. NZ five down with one run behind
short of a good length and outside off, glided backward of point. NZ limp into the lead
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and glides it late past a diving gully
good length and angling across off, ignored
pitched up and outside off, opens the bat-face, drives, and threads the gap at cover
full on the stumps, driven right back at Morkel
short and tucks Raval up for room. Defended
tossed up, full on off, flicked to midwicket
wide of the crease, drifts into the straight bat of Watling
full on off, straight ball, blocked back to Maharaj
skids on outside off, left alone
tossed on off, forward and smothered
really full and outside off, wristly driven to cover
length and outside off, Raval presses forward and defends stoutly
Philander ventures wide of the crease, angled in from around the wicket, blocked to leg off the inside half
full and angled in on off, another compact forward-defensive
fighting fifty from Raval. Overpitched and outside off, Raval stretches forward and drives through the covers for three
full on off, Watling shuffles across and defends to leg
lobbed up on off, and drifts away, Raval prods and edges wide of Amla at slip
full on off, defended back on the front foot
floated up outside off, gets forward and pushes towards cover
tossed up and drifts away in the air, goes past the outside edge and nearly floors Raval
short and spins back in, Raval jumps back and punches down the ground
tossed on off, stretches forward and blocks it back. That's drinks with SA in control of this Test
Philander puts it on a good length outside off, Watling blocks
pitched up and outside off, Watling pushes with an angled bat and edges it in front of second slip

did that carry to Duminy at gully? Indeed, Duminy drops it, despite getting both his hands to the ball. Short and too close to off for a cut. Raval loosely guides it to the fielder, the ball bursts through the hands
just short of a good length and outside off, Raval tightens up and ignores it
loose again! Full and wide outside off, reaches out for the ball with his hands, swishes at a drive and misses
full and outside off, left alone
flat straight ball on off, defended back
floated up outside off, Watling presses forward, meets the pitch and drives through the line to cover
tossed on off, forward and defended to leg
Raval plays back to a pretty full ball - he wasn't ready - wafts to point
wide of the crease, full and angled in on off, dead batted
short and angled in on off from around the wicket, chopped to the cordon
really full and outside off, cuts away like a fast legbreak, Raval reaches out for the ball with his hands and is thoroughly beaten on the drive
short on off, Philander pushes the opener back. Fended to off
short and darts back in on off, Raval is right behind the line
full and outside off, Raval lunges forward and drives to cover
short, angled in, fended to midwicket. Raval searches for a single, not there
full on off, played back to Maharaj
even fuller on off, jabbed back
length ball on off, defended on the front foot
short and angled in, a whirl of the wrists directs the ball through square leg
short and skids on outside off, beats the cut
tossed on a fourth-stump line, presses forward and defends
might full on off, handsomely whipped between midwicket and mid-on
good length and holds its line outside off, Raval ignores it
pitched up and outside off, no shot offered again
length ball, angled in, Raval sits back and clips it to the left of midwicket. Raval equals his highest Test score
lobbed up outside off, left alone
full on off, solid forward-defensive
Raval uses his feet, he is beaten in the air, and drives it out of the footmarks. Raval reaches his highest Test score
flighted on middle, defended with a straight bat
tossed on the stumps, kept out
full on off, comes forward and drives to the left of the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Raval won't go after these
wide of the crease, angled in, straightens outside off, Raval glides it to point
full on off, defended
full and attacking the stumps, Watling ventures forward and across in defence
full on middle, blocked on the front foot again
back of a length on off, you can't get past Watling's defence
slower outside off, Raval brings out a sweep and nails it in front of square
very full and just outside off, shimmies out and whips to midwicket, bursts through the hands of the fielder
full on off, no turn, Watling bends forward in defence
flat outside off, driven to cover
speared outside off, left alone
tossed on the leg stump, Watling kneels low and paddles it really fine on the leg side. No point chasing that, Philander
dragged short and outside off, Raval punishes it. Skips back and pulls it to the right of the square leg umpire
much shorter and quicker on off, Raval is right behind the line in defence
short and slanted across off, left alone
big bouncer on leg stump, Raval ducks, loses his balance, and collapses on the floor
short and whizzing past the helmet again, Raval takes his eyes off the ball
short and on leg, tucks Raval up for room. Raps the glove and rolls to long leg
slides on with the arm on off, played back

De Kock fluffs a stumping chance. Tossed up and drifts in from outside off. Raval comes down the track. Swishes and misses. De Kock misses too. He swipes the bails off in frustration after the ball had passed him. The result is three byes
short offbreak, whipped to midwicket
full and outside off, eased to cover
short and outside off, Watling is solid in defence
full on off, closes the face and drives past the bowler to mid-off
back of a length on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
dug short on the leg stump, swatted away on the bounce to Morkel at fine leg
short on a fifth-stump line, Watling lets it go
short and outside off, glides it to point with soft hands
short and outside off, left alone
off-stump yorker, jammed out to cover
full and slides on off, kept out
very full on off, driven to mid-on on the front foot
maneuvered off the pads to square leg
shortish and outside off, Watling sits back and punches it to the bowler
flat dart down leg, Watling can't connect with the sweep
yorker, tails in at the base of off stump, squeezed out
short on off, fended off to leg
full incoming ball, flicked to short leg
short and outside off, takes his eyes off the ball, and miscues the pull through square leg
full and wide outside off, ignored
rising short ball on off, Raval rises with it and pats it down
short and outside off, leans back and punches to sweeper cover
drifting into the pads, picked off through square leg
straight and short outside off, jabbed to the covers
very full outside off, leans forward and caresses a drive to the left of Rabada at mid-off
tossed on leg stump, defended to short leg
glanced off the pads to square leg
good length and outside off, ignored
good length and on off, Watling presses forward and plays back to the bowler
lifter on middle, Watling ducks under it
short and angled in on off, fended to leg off the glove
keeps it short on off, Watling defends resolutely
floated up outside off, dead batted
tossed on off, uses his feet and blocks quietly
tossed up on off, straight ball, defended
paddled from outside off to long leg. The single brings up the fifty stand
tossed on off, Raval presses forward and smothers it
short and outside off, deflected off the face to point
full-toss outside off, Watling steps forward and offers an extension of a push, places it to the right of mid-off
short and outside off, Raval shoulders arms
full and wide outside off, nothing doing from Raval
Dropped. Dug short and outside off, Raval does not control a pull. Third life for Raval. Miscues it in the air to the right of square leg. Cook shells a fairly simple catch
short and outside off, punched into the covers
full on off, drifts away, pokes to point off an outside edge
very full and outside off, Watling drives with a slicing finish to cover
drifts in on off, gets forward and pushes to short cover
full and drifts in, blocked with bat and pad close together
good length and angled into the straight bat of Rabada
short and down leg, Raval ventures inside the line and leaves
very full and swerves away outside off, Watling throws his bat at a drive and misses. Rare loose shot from him
bouncer on middle, ducks under it
tossed up on off, gets forward and dinks the ball to cover
Raval uses his feet, meets the pitch, and secures a single to mid-on
very full on off, Watling stretches forward and creams a drive. The placement is even better. Hit between extra cover and deep mid-off
drifts in towards middle and leg, inside-edged onto the pad, the ball lobs up to the right of short leg
overpitched and outside off, firmly driven to mid-off on the front foot
Rabada ventures wide of the crease, and angles it into the pads of Raval. Clipped to fine leg
Watling rises on top of this short ball outside off and punches to short cover. Elgar flings to his left and makes a smart stop
full and tails in on a fourth-stump line, left alone
edged and does not carry to slip. Full and outside off, Watling follows the ball. It dies in front of Faf at second slip
short and outside off, leans back and punches to cover
full and wide outside off, Watling lets it go
lobbed up wide outside off, spins in, Raval thrusts his thigh pad out
full on off, defended

Raval's luck runs out. No mistake from de Kock this time. Raval dances down the track, Maharaj smartly loops it up very wide outside off. Raval, who is nowhere close to the pitch, drives and misses. Smart work from de Kock too. Maharaj gets Raval for the second time in this Test
full and drifts in on middle, played back
shimmies out, nice dip, wafted back to the bowler
short and targetting the top of off, blocked on the back foot
bouncer, angled in, forces Watling to duck under it
break-back from outside off, beats the inside edge and the off stump, as Watling drives loosely
a bit too full and outside off, Watling presses forward and drives it gloriously straight of mid-off
short and outside off, jabbed to cover for one
mighty full and outside off, de Grandhomme comes forward and pushes to cover
back of a length and angled in on off, played back to the bowler
flighted on middle, Watling defends carefully
full and rolls on outside off, eased to long-off

It's that man Maharaj again! This is the fantasy of left-arm fingerspinners. Drifts into middle and leg, then turns away sharply past the outside edge to hit the top of off stump. Maharaj sends de Grandhomme back for a duck. De Grandhomme had no clue about this. He missed it by a mile
shorter and outside off, guided to point
full on middle and leg, defended past short leg
full and angling in on off, defended back
short and angled in on off, flicked to long leg
short on the leg stump, gloves a pull to long leg
pitched up and outside off, left alone
lifter, angled in on middle, ducks under
back of a length and aimed at the top of off, kept out
tossed up from wide of the crease, inside-edged onto the back pad
very full on middle, driven past the bowler's right
tossed outside off, driven nicely to long-off
Maharaj claims a five-wicket haul, his second in two Tests. Tossed up on off, length ball, no turn, long-off is back. Southee takes him on. Attempts a loft and ends up toe-ending a catch to Duminy
short and banged down leg, Patel ducks under it
banged in short, Patel moves across off, looks to manufacture a pull. He can only edge it down leg to de Kock
full on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
menacing short ball on off, Wagner loosens his grip and fends off in front of his feet
short and outside off, Wagner has a crack at it and upper-cuts it over the cordon for a boundary
full on middle and leg, defended

Maharaj finishes with career-best returns of 6 for 40. He holds the ball up and leads his team off the field. NZ dismissed for 171. This was floated up on off, Watling uses his feet and eyes an inside-out loft over cover. He ends up hitting it straight to long-off
length ball on the pads. Tucked away through square leg
very full on middle and leg, Cook plays back and drives in the gap between mid-on and midwicket
rising short ball on off, Cook rises with it and drops the ball in front of his feet
wide of the crease, angled into the pads, flicked away through square leg
bouncer on the leg stump, Cook ducks under it
good length and outside off, gets forward and drives solidly to cover
full and holds its line outside off, ignored
full and in the corridor again, Elgar covers his off stump and lets it go
leg-stump half-volley, flicked neatly between mid-on and midwicket

De Grandhomme spins around and belts out an appeal for lbw. Umpire Dharmasena is unmoved. This is clearly heading down leg. Williamson, however, calls for DRS. Neesham live-tweets gesticulates it is heading down. Horrid review. Good length, angling in to beat the inside edge and hit the front pad. Ball-tracker suggests it is heading past the leg stump
worked to leg
full and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
full and angled in, defended back on the front foot
full on off, sliced away through cover
short and aimed at the ribs, fended to the right of short leg
short on off, Cook goes deep in the crease and fends square through the leg side
full and holds its line outside off, skewed to leg off an inside edge

Dropped by Neesham. Very full, angled in on off, wobbles away very late, Cook plays across the line and edges it. Neesham stretches his left hand out at second slip but it does not stick. Raval dives to his right from first slip. It would not have reached him
full on off, defended on the front foot
full and outside off, pushed back to the bowler
pitched up and outside off, left alone
short and outside off, stays back and clips to leg
full on off, worked on the front foot to the right of midwicket
dug short and outside off, pulled to long leg
full on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
edged and Neesham pouches it to his right at second slip. Good length, swerves away, and bounces outside off, Cook spars at it and this carries nicely to Neesham
half-volley outside off, gets forward and creams it through the covers
length ball on off, Amla inches forward and blocks gingerly
pitched up and outside off, ignored
De Grandhomme plugs away outside off, Amla covers his off stump and lets it go
full and angling in on off, presses forward and plays back to the bowler
back of a length on a set of stumps outside off, nothing doing from Elgar
back of a length, closer to off, but not close enough to make Elgar play
full and wide outside off, ignored
short and slanted in on off, defended to leg
length and wide outside off, ignored again
back of a length on off, Southee makes Elgar play. He stands tall and pushes the ball to mid-on
full and angled in, Amla plays around his front pad and blocks to the leg side
good length on off, blocked on the front foot
really full and angling in at leg stump. Amla falls over the flick but this is slipping down leg
full on off, defended back
length ball on off, not a half-volley, presses forward and punchily drives down the ground
De Grandhomme puts it full and outside off, ignored
short and angled in on off,  defended
length ball, angled in, kicks up at the batsman. Quelled onto the pitch
pitched up and outside off, ignored
Amla stands up tall to meet this short ball outside off, punched to the covers
back of a length and rears up outside off, tapped to gully
starts off with a full ball outside off, nibbles away, Elgar fiddled with it before belatedly letting it go
full and outside off, Elgar presses forward, meets the pitch, and drives to cover
full and outside off, leans forward and drives to cover
back of a length outside off, seams away, left alone
full and around off, prodded to point on the front foot
full and outside off, Elgar covers his off stump and shoulders arms
good length on off, solid forward-defensive
back of a length and outside off, Amla chases the ball with his hands and inside-edges it onto his pad
leg-stump half-volley, flicked.... straight to square leg
good length on off, defended
another leg-stump half-volley, Amla latches onto it, flicking in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
good length on a fifth-stump line, ignored
very full on off, gets forward and drives it straight of mid-off
full on off, pushed down to mid-on now
banged short and outside off, Elgar drops his gloves
more short stuff, Elgar ducks and evades it
full on off, driven with a slicing finish to point
bouncer outside off, ducks under it
floated up outside off, no shot offered
straying onto the hips, picked off square of long leg. Wagner runs across and makes a tumbling save near the boundary
on a length and outside off, Amla ventures forward and deftly glides it to gully
back of a length and angled in on off, Amla dabs to midwicket
length on off, front-foot punch between midwicket and mid-on
length and on a sixth-stump line outside off, no shot offered
lifter, angling away outside off, the batsman gets under it
another bouncer, Elgar ducks again
tip and run to cover
good length, angling across off, left alone
pitched full on off, tapped to cover
back of a length and zipping across off, Amla wafts and watches the ball beat the outside edge
full and wide outside, left alone
edged and think it did not carry to Raval at first slip. Good length and outside off, Elgar spars with no feet and gets away as the ball dies to the right of Raval
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers
full, angled in on off, and seams away. Elgar is squared up and beaten on the outside
just short of a good length and outside off, Elgar swats it with intent over midwicket
full on off, defended on the front foot
back of a length on off, blocked
length and outside off, driven on the up through cover
overpitched and outside off, carved square through the off side
bouncer, angling across off, Wagner ducks
Wagner hammers it into the middle of the track again, it flies over a ducking Elgar
short, ducks in, Elgar looks to fend and is smacked on the chest
full on the stumps, defended to leg
short of a length and angled in, fended to leg
full and wide outside off, Elgar does not go after it
back of a length on off, guided to point
full and outside off, left alone again
really full and outside off, no shot offered
back of a length on a fifth-stump line, ignored
full and angled in on off, stylishly whipped between midwicket and mid-on
dug short on off, swatted away to long leg
short of a length on off, Elgar goes deep in the crease and fends the ball to cover

Wagner bounces out Elgar. Head-hunting lifter, angling away from around the wicket on the stumps, Elgar is cramped for room. He is rushed into the shot. He swings his hands at a hook and Watling grabs the top-edge behind the stumps. Consolation for Wagner and New Zealand
slower full ball on off, pushed back
full and angled in on off, Amla ventures forward and across in defence
full and on off, pushed back to the bowler
full and angled in on the stumps, pushed with a straight bat to mid-on
very full on the leg stump, Amla flicks along the ground to midwicket
full and angled in, defended in front of off stump
banged in short on off, Duminy shuffles across off and flaps the ball behind square
lifter, angled in, forces Amla to duck under it
short and bounces over the stumps, Amla, having shuffled across off, leaves
short and angled in at off, hip-high delivery, swatted away to the right of square leg and to the left of long leg. Signs of intent from Amla
lifter on middle, Amla gets under and avoids it
short, angled in, Amla ducks under it
short on off, fended back down the pitch
length ball outside off, Duminy races down the track and sends it clattering over the bowler's head
bouncer outside off, Duminy arches his back and evades it
Neesham errs short and wide outside off again, scythed away past point

short and angling across off, ducks under it
glanced off the hips to square leg
crrrrrrrunched! Really full and outside off, Amla shimmies out and drives it on the up through extra cover. The ball purrs away to the boundary
back of a length, veers away outside off, Amla simply watches it through to the keeper
overpitched and outside off, Amla thumps another drive, but can't beat cover this time
banged in short, angled in at off, Amla rocks his head out of the way
proper bouncer outside off, sails through to the keeper, as Amla bails out of the hook and leaves. Wide called for height
half-tracker outside off, duly dispatched to the square boundary with a powerful cut
pitched up and outside off, drilled to point, who makes a half save
Amla shuffles across off and stylishly whips an off-stump ball through square leg
back of a length and down leg, left alone
short on leg stump, glanced to short fine leg
back of a length and jumps on middle, Amla quells it to leg
head-hunting bouncer, Amla ducks out of the way
short and slanting away outside off, Amla has his eyes locked on the ball before swaying his upper body out of the way
back of a length and drifting outside leg, Duminy can't put bat on ball
short and outside off, Duminy sits back and swats away between midwicket and mid-on for a double

South Africa wrap up the Wellington Test in three days and secure a 1-0 lead. Duminy finishes it off in style. Neesham goes short and wide outside off, hip-high ball, Duminy skips back and nails a pull over square leg
